sen.j: 立太子（りったいし）とは、広く東アジアにおいて広まった儀礼で、中国の皇帝や日本の天皇の皇子を跡継ぎとして皇太子に立てる事である。
sen.e: Rittaishi (the investiture of the crown prince) is a ceremony prevailed in East Asia to settle imperial prince of Chinese or Japanese Emperor as a crown prince for prospective enthronment.
Rittaishi (the investiture of Crown Prince) is a ceremony prevailed in East Asia to officially designate an heir of Chinese or Japanese Emperor as Crown Prince for prospective enthronement.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Rittaishi (the investiture of Crown Prince) is a ceremony prevailed in East Asia to officially designate an heir of Chinese or Japanese Emperor as Crown Prince for prospective enthronement.

sen.j: 日本の朝廷においては、古くは儲君（ちょくん、もうけのきみ）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: In former Japanese imperial court, the crown prince was also called as Chokun (it can also be pronounced as Moke no Kimi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In ancient times, in the Japanese Imperial court, Crown Prince was also called Chokun (which was alternatively pronounced as Moke no kimi).
In ancient times, in the Japanese Imperial court, Crown Prince was also called Chokun (which was alternatively pronounced as Moke no kimi).

sen.j: 儲君を受けた皇子は立太子の礼（立太子礼）の儀式を執り行い、内外に皇嗣たる皇太子に就任したことを宣言する習わしであった。
sen.e: In general, the prince designated as Chokun performed Rittaishi no Rei (the ceremonial investiture of the crown prince) to declare in and out of the imperial court that he became a crown prince who is the heir to the imperial throne.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: An Imperial prince who had been designated as Chokun conventionally performed Rittaishi no Rei (ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince) to declare both domestically and internationally that he became Crown Prince who was the heir to the Imperial throne.

An Imperial prince who had been designated as Chokun conventionally performed Rittaishi no Rei (ceremonial investiture of the Crown Prince) to declare both domestically and internationally that he became Crown Prince who was the heir to the Imperial throne.

sen.j: 儲君に関しては、江戸時代までは皇室典範のような皇位継承の順序を定めた法律がなく、天皇の意思や朝廷、幕府などの介入により、複数の候補者から選ばれるのが慣例であった。
sen.e: Before the Edo period, there was no law that determines the order of the succession to the imperial throne such as Imperial House Act; Chokun, or the crown prince, used to be chosen among the candidates under the wish of the Emperor and the intervention of imperial court, bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), etc.

Before the Edo period, there was no law that determined the order in line to succession to the Imperial throne such as Imperial House Act, and Chokun, or the Crown Prince, was customarily chosen from among plural candidates, intervened by the will of the Emperor and by the court and bakufu (shogunate).
sen.cmt: 表現・文法・形式を修正しました
sen.e: Before the Edo period, there was no law that determined the order in line to succession to the Imperial throne such as Imperial House Act, and Chokun, or the Crown Prince, was customarily chosen from among plural candidates, intervened by the will of the Emperor and by the court and bakufu (shogunate).

sen.j: なお、中世の朝廷衰微の時代には立太子の礼を行う予算がないために儲君が立太子をされないまま、次期天皇に即位した例も多い。
sen.e: However, when the imperial court declined in medieval period, many crown princes ascended to the next imperial throne without Rittaishi due to the lack of the budget for Rittaishi no Rei.

However, during medieval times when the Imperial court's power declined, not a few Crown Princes ascended to the Imperial throne without the ceremonial Rittaishi due to lack of budget for the Rittaishi no Rei.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: However, during medieval times when the Imperial court's power declined, not a few Crown Princes ascended to the Imperial throne without the ceremonial Rittaishi due to lack of budget for the Rittaishi no Rei.

sen.j: 明治以降は皇室の家法として皇室典範が定められた。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, Imperial House Act is defined as the imperial family code of conduct.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Meiji period, Imperial House Act was enacted as Imperial Family regulations.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: After the Meiji period, Imperial House Act was enacted as Imperial Family regulations.

sen.j: 皇位継承の順序が厳格に定められるようになり、重大な病気などでない限り、皇位継承順位の変更は許されないこととなった。
sen.e: Order of the succession to the imperial throne was strictly determined; change of the order became unacceptable unless the case of serious disease, etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thereafter, the order of succession to the Imperial throne was strictly regulated by the law, and any change in the order became unallowable unless he had serious health problems or the like.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Thereafter, the order of succession to the Imperial throne was strictly regulated by the law, and any change in the order became unallowable unless he had serious health problems or the like.

sen.j: これにより、天皇の皇子の中で、継承順位が最も高い者が「皇嗣たる皇子」として皇太子に立てられる事となった。
sen.e: Accordingly, a prince who was the first in line to the imperial throne among the imperial princes came to be settled as a crown prince who is the heir to the imperial throne.
Accordingly, an Imperial prince who was the first in line to the Imperial throne began to be considered 'Imperial prince who was the heir to the throne' and appointed Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式を修正しました
sen.e: Accordingly, an Imperial prince who was the first in line to the Imperial throne began to be considered 'Imperial prince who was the heir to the throne' and appointed Crown Prince.

sen.j: 明治時代以降は、4例の立太子礼が行われている。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, four Rittaishi no Rei have taken place.
After the Meiji period, the Rittaishi no Rei took place four times.
After the Meiji period, the Rittaishi no Rei took place four times.
